Text:
Keep it simple and take advantage of list comprehension!

    def lastfirst(l):
        return [[x.split(',')[1] for x in l],  [x.split(',')[1] for x in l]]
    
    print lastfirst(['Gerber, Len', 'Fox, Kate', 'Dunn, Bob'])

It will print

    [[' Len', ' Kate', ' Bob'], [' Len', ' Kate', ' Bob']]

Keep it simple and take advantage of list comprehension!

    def lastfirst(l):
        return [[x.split(',')[1].strip() for x in l],  [x.split(',')[0].strip() for x in l]]
    
    print lastfirst(['Gerber, Len', 'Fox, Kate', 'Dunn, Bob'])

It will print

    [['Len', 'Kate', 'Bob'], ['Gerber', 'Fox', 'Dunn']]
